decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, supported by powerful finishers such as Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. Cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition provide versatility and disruption. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to green and white mana sources. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben slows down opponents, while cards like Aven Interrupter and Ouroboroid provide additional aggression. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of creatures, removal, and disruption.

The main focus of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger. With powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, along with the ability to pump up creatures with Monstrous Rage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional sources of damage, while Sunspine Lynx and Lightning Strike offer flexibility in dealing with threats. Overall, this deck is designed to be fast and punishing.

This Orzhov control deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to strip away the opponent's hand, while utilizing removal options such as Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to deal with threats on the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Gifted Aetherborn and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to provide additional board presence and pressure. With a combination of hand disruption, removal, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent until it can secure a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a board presence. By combining creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic with powerful cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition, the strategy aims to apply constant pressure and tempo control. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer provide additional threats and board control. The goal is to establish dominance early in the game and maintain pressure until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this Izzet Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw. By controlling the board and drawing into key cards like Divide by Zero and Stormchaser's Talent, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources. Cards like Abandon Attachments and Combustion Technique provide removal options, while Gran-Gran, Otawara, and Cori-Steel Cutter offer powerful win conditions. Overall, the deck thrives on controlling the tempo of the game and out-valuing the opponent with efficient spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Skyclave Apparition to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With support from cards like Collected Company and Elspeth, Storm Slayer, the deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent early on. The inclusion of mana ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves allows for quick deployment of threats, while the land base is optimized for consistent mana production. Overall, the deck is designed to maintain a steady stream of threats in order to win the game through aggressive play.

This deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and efficient creatures to control the game and grind out advantage over the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Preacher of the Schism to apply pressure and win the game. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent through resource management and efficient use of removal and threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. The deck aims to utilize cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger along with cheap instant spells like Fiery Impulse and Reckless Rage to continuously apply pressure and chip away at the opponent's life total. By maintaining a fast pace and overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats, this deck aims to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize or mount a strong defense.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble and utilize the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and abilities. The deck includes various support cards such as Formidable Speaker and Witherbloom Command to help set up the combo, along with disruption cards like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan. By efficiently utilizing the resources and abilities of the cards in the deck, the player aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenixes onto the battlefield by casting spells and utilizing cards like Artist's Talent and Consider to trigger their ability. The deck also includes a mix of other spells and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a focus on speed and aggression, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The primary focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects to outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes a companion creature, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, which provides additional utility and synergy with the rest of the cards in the deck. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until victory can be achieved through card advantage or a well-timed finisher.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. The deck also leverages the powerful creature Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to generate value and pressure the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes versatile lands like Mutavault and Bleachbone Verge to ensure consistent mana production and allow for various strategies. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast the opponent and secure victory through efficient control and strategic plays.

The key theme of this deck is to control the game by using countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while patiently building up resources and eventually overwhelming them with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the rest of the deck, allowing for a more consistent and versatile playstyle. This UW Control deck excels at managing threats and securing victory through careful planning and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro Pioneer deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. This is achieved by using efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves, Badgermole Cub, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly build a board presence. The deck also includes disruption cards like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Collected Company is used to quickly refill the board with more creatures. The deck aims to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent to win the game quickly.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition to control the battlefield. With mana acceleration from cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The inclusion of Collected Company allows for additional creature advantage, while cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer provide additional late-game finisher options. The deck aims to outpace opponents and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This aggro deck is focused on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through a combination of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, and repeatable damage sources like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Ramunap Ruins. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game, using cards like Monstrous Rage and Screaming Nemesis to maximize damage output. It also includes some land utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to provide additional damage or card advantage.
